clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Patient-Centered Care Delivery Among Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
clinical_study.official_title: An Integrative Multilevel Study for Improving Patient-Centered Care Delivery Among Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study involves development and testing of a patient and family-centered transitional care program for patients who are hospitalized with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) exacerbations. The intervention offers tailored services to address individual patients' biopsychosocial needs, starting early during hospital stay and continuing for 3 months post hospital discharge. The study hypothesis is that compared to usual care, the study intervention will : a) Improve patient health- related quality of life and survival, and reduce use of hospital and emergency room visits; b) result in improved patient experience, self- confidence, and self-care behaviors; c) result in improved family caregivers coping skills, self-confidence, and problem solving skills to address patient barriers to care and treatment.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Mean combined number of COPD-related hospitalizations and emergency room visits per patient
primary_outcome.description: 'Index -hospitalization' is the hospitalization during which a patient is enrolled into the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in patients' scores on the St. George Respiratory Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6 months post 'index-hospitalization' compared to baseline

arm_group.description: Usual Care: Standard healthcare services will be received. Study participants in this arm will not receive any additional study interventions.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patient and Family-Centered Transitional Care Intervention
arm_group.description: Study participants randomized to this arm will be offered an integrated multifaceted intervention that includes comprehensive biopsychosocial assessment, a tailored treatment plan, a tailored disease management program, and care management support services .

intervention.intervention_name: Patient and Family-Centered Transitional Care Intervention
intervention.description: A patient and family- centered transitional care intervention that includes a comprehensive biopsychosocial assessment, a tailored treatment plan, a tailored disease management program, and care management support services .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any patient hospitalized due to a COPD exacerbation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Terminal condition limiting life span to less than 6 months
